preqs: Twelve credit points of second-year Literary studies units, including one cornerstone unit in literary studies, or permission from the unit coordinator.

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ATS2422, ATS2485, ATS2508, ATS2517} and  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ATS2163, ATS2164, ATS2379, ATS2409, ATS2427, ATS2442, ATS2443, ATS2444, ATS2492, ATS2500, ATS2513, ATS2516, ATS2519, ATS2732, ATS2898, ATS2914, ATS2915})
(Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ACL2%, AEH2%, AMU2%, ASA2%, ATS2%, AZA2%} and  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ATS2422, ATS2485, ATS2508, ATS2510, ATS2517})

description: The unit explores key questions and debates animating contemporary literary research. Students will be introduced to the concerns, methodologies, controversies and debates in selected aspects of the discipline. They will consider the implications of these scholarly arguments for the study of literature and the communication of research in literary studies. Students will consider these implications through case studies of selected authors and their bodies of work.
